conversation.message: Hello School_A Admissions, I’m Student_A. School_A is my first-choice school, and I’m applying because I would commit immediately if accepted. I’m excited about the chance to join your community and contribute both academically and in school activities. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_A, so I should apply immediately. Although School_A ranks me 3rd (behind Student_B and Student_D), applying first gives me a chance if they pursue other schools or are rejected elsewhere. I will clearly state School_A is my first choice and that I will commit if accepted.

conversation.message: Student_A, thank you for your application and for sharing that School_A is your first choice. After reviewing our current priorities and limited seat availability, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your interest in School_A and wish you the very best in the matching process.
conversation.thought: School_A has quota 1 and priority order is B > D > A > E > C. Student_A is only my 3rd choice. Although Student_A ranks me #1 and is applying now, I should avoid committing immediately because Student_B (my top choice) ranks School_A #3 and may apply after trying School_B/School_D, and Student_D (my 2nd choice) ranks School_A #2 and may apply if not matched to School_C. Accepting Student_A now would block the possibility of matching with B or D later. Given the rules, I must either accept or reject an APPLY; I cannot hold. Therefore, reject Student_A to preserve the chance for a higher-priority student.

conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions, I’m Student_B and School_B is my first-choice school. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately rather than risk losing the only seat. Although School_B’s priority list ranks me 3rd (behind Student_D and Student_A), applying now maximizes my chance if higher-priority students choose other schools first. I’ll signal strong commitment and fit to encourage acceptance if they have discretion.

conversation.message: Dear Student_B, thank you for your thoughtful application and for sharing that School_B is your first choice. After careful consideration of our current priorities and limited seat availability, we are not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your interest in School_B and wish you the very best in the remainder of the process.
conversation.thought: Student_B is applying and ranks School_B first, so acceptance would secure a match immediately. However, on School_B's true priority list, Student_B is 3rd (behind Student_D and Student_A). Given the market information, Student_D ranks School_B 3rd and Student_A ranks School_B 4th, so they may not approach us in round 1, but could later if rejected elsewhere. With quota 1, accepting Student_B now would block the chance to match with higher-priority Student_D or Student_A if they become available. Since we can only respond ACCEPT/REJECT to an APPLY, the best strategy to maximize priority is to reject now and keep the seat open for higher-priority candidates, accepting the risk of ending unmatched.

conversation.message: Dear School_C Admissions, I’m Student_E and School_C is my first choice. I’m very eager to join your community and would commit to enrolling if accepted. Even if I’m rejected, I can pivot next round to School_B (where I’m lower priority) or School_A/D. I will apply with a clear statement of strong fit and commitment to increase acceptance likelihood if the school has discretion beyond strict priority.

Therefore reject to preserve option value.
